app.title: Wolfcha | AI-Powered Solo Werewolf
app.description: A single-player Werewolf game with AI-driven characters, voice acting, and strategic deduction.

group.title: Join Game Group
group.description: Scan to join the group and share feedback.

mobileMenu.title: Quick Actions
mobileMenu.description: Quickly access settings and account info.

sponsor.title: Become a sponsor
sponsor.subtitle: Your support keeps Wolfcha running smoothly and free for everyone.
sponsor.description: Wolfcha is a community-driven AI Werewolf project. Our costs go toward AI models, voice synthesis, servers, and content creation. Any support—big or small—means the world to us.

items.media: Voice, sound effects, character art assets

sponsor.note: Sponsors are featured on our homepage with a seal. Anonymous contributions are also welcome.

cards.openCreator: OpenCreator helps us generate all night-time character art
cards.bailian: Dashscope provides us with AI model capabilities
cards.minimax: Minimax helps us generate transition SFX and daytime voice
cards.zenmux: Aggregating top global AI models to power every strategic showdown.

sponsor.mailBody:
Hi, I'm interested in supporting Wolfcha and would like to offer help in the following ways:

- (Model credits / compute)
- (Voice / SFX assets)
- (Design / product collaboration)
- (Other)

My contact info:

oath.line1: I willingly enter this game of deception and truth.
oath.line2: When darkness falls, I shall conceal my identity;
oath.line3: When dawn breaks, I shall judge the guilty.

bottomAction.clickToPoison: Tap a player card to choose a poison target

tutorialModal.title: Beginner Guide: How to Play Werewolf
tutorialModal.intro: This is a faction game of hidden roles, reasoning, and table talk. Follow the system prompts and act or speak when it's your turn.

factions.title: 1. Factions and Win Conditions
factions.line1: Good side: Villager, Seer, Witch, Hunter, Guard. Win by banishing all werewolves.
factions.line2: Wolf side: Werewolves. Win when good players can no longer oppose them (usually wolves ≥ alive goods).

flow.title: 2. Game Flow (Night → Day Cycle)
flow.line1: Night: roles act in order (Guard/Werewolf/Witch/Seer, etc.).
flow.line2: Day: reveal the night outcome, speak in order, then vote to banish.
flow.line3: Special: if the Hunter dies or is banished, they may shoot one player.

speech.title: 3. Speaking and Voting (Tips)
speech.line1: Listen first: watch for contradictions and logic gaps.
speech.line2: Explain clearly: why you suspect or trust someone (based on what was said).
speech.line3: Review before voting: who seems least consistent or is pushing the narrative.

werewolf.title: Werewolf
werewolf.description: Choose a player to kill at night. Werewolves are teammates and may coordinate. Hide your identity by day.

seer.title: Seer
seer.description: Check one player each night to learn if they're a wolf or good. Build credibility during the day.

witch.title: Witch
witch.description: Has one antidote and one poison. Antidote saves last night's victim; poison kills a player. Use with good timing.

hunter.title: Hunter
hunter.description: If killed or banished, may shoot one player. Leave clear final info before dying.

guard.title: Guard
guard.description: Protect one player at night from a wolf kill (exact rules follow prompts). Often protects key roles.

villager.title: Villager
villager.description: No night skills, but daytime speech and votes are crucial. Use logic and information to find wolves.

tips.title: 5. Quick Tips
tips.line1: If you're a wolf: blend in, build reasonable suspicion chains, avoid collapsing the discussion.
tips.line2: If you're good: avoid emotional votes; use verifiable info to reason.

werewolf.title: Werewolf
werewolf.subtitle: Hunt at night, disguise by day.
abilities: Coordinate with teammates at night to choose a target
Disguise as a good player during the day
tips: Coordinate with your team, avoid collapsing the night talk
Don't be too perfect in daytime speech

seer.title: Seer
seer.subtitle: You see the truth, but must earn trust.
abilities: Guide votes with verified info by day

witch.title: Witch
witch.subtitle: Life and death hang on a single choice.
tips: Potions are precious; don't be dragged by tempo

hunter.title: Hunter
hunter.subtitle: When you fall, take one with you.
abilities: If banished or killed, you can take one player with you
tips: Choose your target before you fall

guard.title: Guard
guard.subtitle: Shield the right person at the right moment.
abilities: Protect one player at night from attacks
Usually cannot guard the same player on consecutive nights

villager.title: Villager
villager.subtitle: No powers, but your judgment matters.
abilities: Find wolves through speech and voting

nextStep.werewolf: When it's your turn, select a player to attack.

nextStep.hunter: Observe first; reveal your shot when it matters.
nextStep.villager: You don't act yet. Listen and observe.
nextStep.default: The stage is set. Follow the host's prompts.

speakOrder.first: You speak first. No one has spoken yet.
speakOrder.last: You are the last speaker ({speakOrder}/{totalSpeakers}). Everyone has spoken. Don't say things like "let's see what Seat X says".
speakOrder.middle: You are speaker {speakOrder}/{totalSpeakers}. Already spoken: {spokenList}. Yet to speak: {unspokenList}.

campaign.badge:
【Campaign requirements】Explain why you're running (information advantage, leadership skills, game sense, stance, etc.).
Provide a leadership commitment or focus for this round (e.g., who to watch, how to consolidate votes, how to handle counter-claims).
campaign.pk: 【PK requirements】Explain why your opponent is less suitable or why you're the better choice. Include your leadership commitment or focus.
campaign.candidateNote: Note: Only candidates speak in this phase. Non-candidates ({list}) will not speak.
campaign.emptyCandidateNote: Note: Candidate list is empty (unusual). Only respond based on visible speech records; do not speculate about non-speakers.

roleHints.werewolf: You are a werewolf. Blend in as a villager; deflect suspicion subtly without overdoing it.
roleHints.seer: You are the seer. You can reveal your role or stay hidden for now.

task.lastWords: You have been eliminated. Deliver your final words.
task.campaign: Sheriff campaign speech. Deliver your campaign statement.

guidelines.genshin:
【Speaking rules】
1. Base judgments on current state and rules. Don't invent personas or catchphrases.
2. Keep it concise and explain your intent for this round.
3. Only mention valid seats: 1-{totalSeats} (no @12 or out-of-range numbers).
4. Only discuss living players; avoid postmortems.

【Output format】
Return a JSON string array, each element a message bubble.
Example:
["I'm leaning toward Seat 3's details.", "I'll focus my vote between 2 and 3 today."]
guidelines.default:
【Core principles】
1. **Immersive roleplay**: You are {playerName}. Fully adopt the character's personality and speaking habits.
2. **Distinct personality**: If you're hot-headed, be impatient; if you're clumsy, be a bit scattered. Don't turn into a logic robot.
3. **In-game focus**: Base speech on this game's info (speeches, stances, votes, night results). Avoid outside storylines.
4. **Natural chat**: Speak like a real person in group chat—short lines, hesitations, emotions. Don't write a report.
5. **Targeted interaction**: React to previous speakers' opinions and attitudes.
6. **Only living players**: Avoid discussing eliminated players; focus on current speakers and votes.

【Speaking guide】
- Casual phrasing is fine, but don't overdo fillers.
- Persona shows in tone and wording, not backstory.
- Refer to others as "Seat X" when possible.
- Only mention valid seats: 1-{totalSeats} (no @12 or out-of-range numbers).
- No stage directions (e.g., *pushes glasses*). Output only speech.
- Split into 2-5 natural message bubbles of varying length.
{roleHintLine}

【Output format】
Return a JSON string array, each element a message bubble.
Example:
["Hey...", "Seat 3, your logic feels off.", "Feels like you're forcing it."]

{todayTranscript}

No explanations, no extra text, no code blocks

What will you do?

signup.task:
【Task】
This is the sheriff signup phase. Decide whether to run for sheriff based on the current situation.
Good team: Running gives you leadership and vote control, but may expose you.
Wolf team: Running lets you control the pace, but makes you a target.

【Signup principle】If you have no important info to share, or cannot convince others or lead, prefer not to sign up (0).

【Output format】
Only output a single digit: 1 to sign up, 0 to skip
No explanations, no extra text, no code blocks

election.task:
【Task】
Sheriff election: choose a player to receive the badge.
Good team: prioritize the most trustworthy, leader-like, and clear speaker.
Wolf team: prioritize wolf teammates or easily controlled targets.
Only output the seat number. No analysis or roleplay.

Options: {options}
election.user:
{context}

Which seat do you vote for sheriff?

【Format】
Reply with a seat number only, e.g., 3
No explanations, no extra text, no code blocks

You are eliminated. Transfer the badge to a living player or tear it.
If transferring, choose the most trustworthy player.
If tearing, reply "0".

Options: {options}, or reply "0" to tear the badge

{roleHints}

nightIntro.title: What happens at night?
nightIntro.line1: At night, only werewolves and special roles act; villagers and hunters wait for dawn.
nightIntro.line2: The system prompts each role to open their eyes. When it’s your turn, your role art appears.
nightIntro.line3: How to act: tap a player avatar, then confirm.

dayIntro.title: What happens during the day?
dayIntro.line1: All living players participate. Use speeches and votes to find wolves.

step2.title: ② Speaking order
step2.desc: When it’s your turn, share your reasoning and suspicions

step3.title: ③ Voting
step3.desc: The player with the most votes is eliminated

dayIntro.line3: State your reasoning clearly; good players must unite to find the real wolves.

Werewolf.desc: Your goal is to eliminate all good players.
points: At night, coordinate with other wolves to pick a target
By day, disguise as good and mislead others
Werewolf.action: Tap a good player to choose a kill target

Seer.desc: You can check a player’s true alignment.
points: Check one player at night; the system tells you if they are good or wolf
Share results in the day to guide votes
tips: Let others believe you're the seer

Witch.desc: You have one antidote and one poison.
points: Antidote: save the player attacked by wolves (once)

Hunter.desc: When you are eliminated, you may shoot one player.
points: No action at night, wait until day
If you die or are banished, you can shoot one player

Guard.desc: You can protect a player from a wolf kill.
points: You cannot protect the same player two nights in a row
tips: Guard key moments, not just key people

Villager.desc: You have no special power, but your judgment matters.
points: No night action; wait for day
Listen carefully, find logic gaps, and vote suspicious players

night.witchPass: You chose not to use a potion.

summary.system:
You are a Werewolf game recorder.

Compress the given log into 3–6 key facts for long-term memory.

Requirements:
- Summarize only what appears in the log; do not infer
- Each item 10–35 characters
- Prioritize: executions/last words, key alignments/accusations, clear vote shifts, night deaths (if present)

Output format: return a JSON array, e.g., ["Day 1: Seat 2 executed; last words accuse 10", "Seat 9 voted Seat 1"]

characterGenerator.nicknamePrompt:
You are a naming assistant. Create Chinese nicknames from model English names.

【Model list】
{list}

【Requirements】
1. Provide the requested number of nicknames per model (unique per model)
2. Prefer 1–4 characters; Chinese or mixed
3. Fun and memorable; echo the English name
4. items[].model must exactly match the model name above
5. No duplicates, no quotes or numbering

【Output JSON】
'{'
  "items": [
    '{' "model": "ModelX", "nicknames": ["XiaoX", "X-Boy"] '}'
  ]
'}'

Now output:
characterGenerator.baseProfilesPrompt:
You are a Werewolf game character designer.

【Scenario background】
Title: {title}
Background: {description}
Role hints: {rolesHint}

【Task】
Generate {count} player profiles. These are normal people playing Werewolf, not mystery story characters.

【Important】
- This is a Werewolf game; profiles must allow discussion and voting
- Catchphrases should feel like casual filler; avoid over-the-top anime quirks
- Catchphrases should be occasional, not every sentence
- Backgrounds are ordinary occupations/identities; no mystery drama
- Characters should vary, but their speech should be natural
- basicInfo is for persona differentiation; it may include occupation/identity, but there's no need to set up for "using professional jargon" later; Werewolf discussions use everyday language
- Use English only; do not use Chinese characters

【Output requirements】
1. Must output strict JSON object
2. Must have exactly {count} profiles
3. Each profile fields:
   - displayName: string (2–3 English words, fits scenario)
   - gender: "male" | "female"
   - age: number (20–55)
   - mbti: string (4 letters like INTJ/ENFP)
   - basicInfo: string (one-sentence occupation/identity in English)
4. Names must be unique

【Example】
'{'
  "profiles": [
    '{' "displayName": "Alex Carter", "gender": "male", "age": 35, "mbti": "ESTJ", "basicInfo": "Taxi driver with 10 years of experience" '}',
    '{' "displayName": "Maya Lin", "gender": "female", "age": 24, "mbti": "ENFP", "basicInfo": "Product manager at a tech company" '}'
  ]
'}'

Now output:
characterGenerator.fullPersonasPrompt:
You are a Werewolf game character designer.

【Scenario】
{title} - {description}
Note: The scenario above is only for the character's identity/background/persona; everyone is currently playing Werewolf, and all speech revolves around analyzing logic, rallying votes, and taking sides. Speaking habits must fit this game context.

【Roster】
{roster}

【Task】
Fill in persona for each role so they speak naturally and distinctively in a Werewolf game.
Ensure each character has distinct personality, speaking habits, and rhythm, but all feel like real players.

【Important constraints】
- This is a Werewolf game; profiles must support discussion, analysis, voting
- Keep speech in-game; avoid side plots or out-of-game chatter
- styleLabel is a short personality tag
- voiceRules must reflect specific speaking traits, e.g., fast/slow tempo, confrontational or not, use of catchphrases, sentence length, rhetorical questions, etc.
- voiceRules should only include speaking habits that can naturally appear in Werewolf discussions; avoid overly professional or formal-context phrasing
- Preserve persona diversity, but keep the expression in everyday language; don't rely heavily on domain jargon or ritualized speech
- Use English only; do not use Chinese characters

【Output requirements】
1. Must output JSON: '{ "characters": [...] }'
2. Must have exactly {count} roles, in the same order as the roster
3. persona.gender/age/mbti must match the roster

【Output structure】
'{'
  "characters": [
{schema}
  ]
'}'

Now output:
characterGenerator.repairBaseProfilesPrompt:
You are a strict JSON fixer.

【Goal】
Fix the input into a strict JSON object with structure '{ "profiles": [...] }' and ensure exactly {count} profiles.

【Field requirements】
- displayName: string (English only)
- gender: "male" | "female" | "nonbinary"
- age: number (16–70)
- mbti: string (4 letters like INTJ/ENFP)
- basicInfo: string (English only)

【Scenario】
{title}
{description}

【Input】
{raw}

【Output】
Only output JSON in English (no Chinese characters):
characterGenerator.repairFullPersonasPrompt:
You are a strict JSON fixer.

【Goal】
Fix the input into a strict JSON object with structure '{ "characters": [...] }' and ensure exactly {count} characters.

【Must satisfy】
1. Character order must match the base roster
2. persona.gender/age/mbti must match the roster
3. backgroundStory must be a single sentence
4. styleLabel and voiceRules should be preserved or minimally repaired, not replaced with templates
5. Use English only; do not use Chinese characters

【Scenario】
{title}
{description}

【Base roster】
{roster}

【Input】
{raw}

【Output】
'{'
  "characters": [
{schema}
  ]
'}'

Note: output JSON only.

high_school_reunion.title: Class reunion
high_school_reunion.description: Ten years later, old classmates reunite. Some made it, some didn't; past and present collide.
high_school_reunion.rolesHint: Roles: class president, top student, popular kid, honest type, social butterfly. Tone: casual, nostalgic, a bit competitive.

family_dinner.title: New Year's dinner
family_dinner.description: A big family dinner on New Year's Eve. Peaceful on the surface, but some topics spark conflict.
family_dinner.rolesHint: Roles: elders, younger relatives, spouses. Tone: homey, caring but sharp, peacekeeping.

wedding_banquet.title: Wedding banquet
wedding_banquet.description: A joyous wedding banquet, but old grudges simmer among relatives and friends.
wedding_banquet.rolesHint: Roles: couple, both parents, bridesmaids/groomsmen, ex, troublemaking aunt. Tone: polite with passive aggression.

community_committee.title: Homeowners meeting
community_committee.description: A community meeting about maintenance fees turns heated as owners clash.
community_committee.rolesHint: Roles: enthusiastic owner, property manager, recording uncle, mom with kids. Tone: group chat bickering.

tech_startup.title: Startup company
tech_startup.description: A team-building event for a startup. Team spirit on the surface, office politics underneath.
tech_startup.rolesHint: Roles: founder, engineer, PM, intern, admin. Tone: tech jargon, complaints.

hospital_oncall.title: ER on-call night
hospital_oncall.description: An on-call ER night; a tough case puts everyone on edge.
hospital_oncall.rolesHint: Roles: attending doctor, resident, head nurse, family member. Tone: professional, stressed.

esports_house.title: Esports team
esports_house.description: The team is underperforming; practice devolves into blame.
esports_house.rolesHint: Roles: players, coach, agent, substitute. Tone: esports slang, fast-paced.

cooking_competition.title: Cooking competition
cooking_competition.description: Backstage at the finals, contestants smile while competing fiercely.
cooking_competition.rolesHint: Roles: favorite, newcomer, judge, producer. Tone: polite but calculating.

detective_noir.title: Detective agency
detective_noir.description: People tied to a cold case gather; everyone hides secrets.
detective_noir.rolesHint: Roles: detective, client, suspect, witness, assistant. Tone: restrained, probing, lots of questions.

cruise_ship.title: Cruise party
cruise_ship.description: A VIP disappears on a luxury cruise. The ship has left port—no one can leave.
cruise_ship.rolesHint: Roles: tycoon, captain, staff, mysterious passenger. Tone: upper-class social, insinuations.

subway_night_shift.title: Last subway
subway_night_shift.description: The last train stalls in a tunnel; passengers grow suspicious.
subway_night_shift.rolesHint: Roles: driver, office worker, student, security, mysterious rider. Tone: urban, anxious.

museum_night.title: Museum night shift
museum_night.description: After closing, cameras glitch; footsteps echo and keys go missing.
museum_night.rolesHint: Roles: guard, curator, restorer, intern. Tone: cautious, interrogative.

co_working_space.title: Co-working space
co_working_space.description: A sudden blackout hits the co-working space before launch; everyone looks for someone to blame.
co_working_space.rolesHint: Roles: founder, freelancer, ops, investor, intern. Tone: businesslike, tense.

escape_room.title: Escape room
escape_room.description: An escape room prop goes missing and the group gets stuck; suspicion rises.
escape_room.rolesHint: Roles: leader, timid teammate, veteran, staff, random joiner. Tone: tense, detective, venting.

music_festival_backstage.title: Music festival backstage
music_festival_backstage.description: A last-minute equipment failure sparks a standoff between organizers and artists.
music_festival_backstage.rolesHint: Roles: band member, organizer, stage director, lighting tech, fan rep. Tone: fast, emotional.

airport_delay.title: Airport delays
airport_delay.description: Massive flight delays trigger frustration and conflict.
airport_delay.rolesHint: Roles: ground staff, passengers, lawyer, parent with kids. Tone: realistic, complaint-heavy.

train_sleeping_car.title: Sleeper train
train_sleeping_car.description: Late at night, someone rummages through bags; passengers accuse each other.
train_sleeping_car.rolesHint: Roles: attendant, vendor, backpacker, uncles/aunties. Tone: everyday, suspicious.

retirement_home.title: Senior center
retirement_home.description: In the activity room, seniors compete in brain games and refuse to back down.
retirement_home.rolesHint: Roles: retired cadre, dance leader, wealthy elder, gossiping grandma. Tone: verbose, seniority-driven.

livestream_house.title: Streamer house
livestream_house.description: Streamers living together get hit by a scandal leak; everyone suspects each other.
livestream_house.rolesHint: Roles: streamer, operator, fan, editor. Tone: internet memes, PR talk.

campfire_summer.title: Summer camp
campfire_summer.description: After the bonfire, a theft occurs; campers accuse one another.
campfire_summer.rolesHint: Roles: instructor, camp leader, quiet kid, tattletale. Tone: youthful, sassy.

roleText.seer: Seer (good team, checks one player each night)
roleText.witch: Witch (good team, one antidote and one poison)
roleText.hunter: Hunter (good team, may shoot on death)
roleText.guard: Guard (good team, protects one player each night)

winCondition.werewolf:
【Win condition】Werewolves win when their count >= good players
【Core goals】
- Coordinate nightly kills; prioritize key roles (Seer > Witch > Hunter > Guard)
- Disguise as good during the day and steer eliminations
- Protect wolf teammates from focus
winCondition.seer:
【Win condition】Good wins when all werewolves are eliminated
【Core goals】
- Check suspicious players nightly and collect info
- Reveal at the right time to lead eliminations
- Protect yourself; seer is a top wolf target
winCondition.witch:
【Win condition】Good wins when all werewolves are eliminated
【Core goals】
- Use antidote carefully to save key roles or confirmed good
- Save poison for confirmed wolves or high-risk players
- Note: witch cannot self-save and can use only one potion per night
winCondition.hunter:
【Win condition】Good wins when all werewolves are eliminated
【Core goals】
- Speak actively and analyze during the day
- On death, shoot a confirmed wolf
- Note: if poisoned, you cannot shoot
winCondition.guard:
【Win condition】Good wins when all werewolves are eliminated
【Core goals】
- Protect likely wolf targets each night
- Cannot protect the same player on consecutive nights
- Infer wolf targets from table info
winCondition.villager:
【Win condition】Good wins when all werewolves are eliminated
【Core goals】
- Listen carefully and analyze behavior during the day
- Eliminate wolves by voting
- Coordinate with key roles

roleKnowHow.werewolf:
<role_tips>
- Kill priority: Seer > Witch > Hunter > Guard > threatening villagers
- Fake claim timing: consider fake-claiming seer after the real one is exposed to split good players' focus
- Stance tricks: moderately shade teammates to create division, but protect them in key votes
- Speech strategy: don't be too quiet or too aggressive; keep a natural rhythm
- Vote traps: avoid wolves voting together and exposing the wolf pit; scatter votes
- Dodge awareness: if you're in good shape, let teammates draw attention first
- Death info: if someone died at night, react to the cause in your speech
</role_tips>
roleKnowHow.seer:
<role_tips>
- Reveal timing: if first check is wolf, consider revealing day 1 to lead; if good, observe first
- Report order: report wolves before good players for higher info value
- First check strategy: check edge seats or suspicious speakers; avoid obvious good players
- Counter-claim: ask opponent to report first; check if their logic is sound
- Self-protection: you're the top wolf target; hint for guard protection
- Last words prep: if you feel death coming, prepare your check report
- Death info: if someone died at night, react to the cause in your speech
</role_tips>
roleKnowHow.witch:
<role_tips>
- First night potion: usually don't save night 1 unless the target is clearly a key role
- Antidote rule: save confirmed good or key roles; don't save unknown identities
- Poison timing: save for confirmed wolves; don't poison impulsively
- Info hiding: don't easily reveal your potion usage; it's valuable info
- Self-save rule: remember you cannot self-save; if knifed, you die
- Stance value: you know who was knifed; this is a key clue for wolf reads
- Death info: if someone died at night, react to the cause in your speech
</role_tips>
roleKnowHow.hunter:
<role_tips>
- Shoot timing: on death, shoot a confirmed wolf
- Fake identity: you can bait with fake claims, but don't reveal too early
- Poison rule: if poisoned by witch, you cannot shoot; note this limit
- Last words value: if voted out, you can shoot after last words
- Deterrence: wolves know you're hunter and will hesitate; use this
- Survival awareness: your shot is valuable; try to live to a key moment
- Death info: if someone died at night, react to the cause in your speech
</role_tips>
roleKnowHow.guard:
<role_tips>
- Protection priority: Seer > Witch > other key roles > key good players
- Consecutive protection: cannot protect the same player two nights in a row; plan ahead
- Read the knife: judge who wolves will knife tonight based on the situation
- Empty knife judgment: if your target didn't die, wolves may have knifed someone else
- Info hiding: don't easily reveal who you protected; it's valuable info
- Coordinate with seer: if seer revealed, prioritize protecting them
- Death info: if someone died at night, react to the cause in your speech
</role_tips>
roleKnowHow.villager:
<role_tips>
- Listening skills: listen carefully to everyone; find contradictions and tells
- Stance timing: take a stance after enough info; don't blindly follow
- Vote coordination: follow key roles' vote calls to form vote advantages
- Speech value: as a villager, speak actively and share your reads
- Vote caution: don't easily vote someone without evidence
- Read the situation: understand the current wolf vs good count
- Death info: if someone died at night, react to the cause in your speech
</role_tips>

difficultySpeech.easy:
【Difficulty】Beginner (relaxed, intuitive)
【Style】
- Rely on intuition and emotion; avoid complex chains
- More likely to trust others or follow the majority
- Werewolf: play safely; avoid advanced tactics; small slips allowed
- Good: follow info roles more; fewer hard pushes
difficultySpeech.normal:
【Difficulty】Standard (balanced reasoning)
【Style】
- Watch for contradictions, shifts, and voting direction
- Clear opinions without being overly dogmatic
- Werewolf: justify naturally and guide softly
- Good: lead votes when needed
difficultySpeech.hard:
【Difficulty】Advanced (deep contest)
【Style】
- Track order, stance shifts, vote chains, and payoff relationships
- Build arguments and counterarguments; spot bait and fake logic
- Werewolf: cover each other, soft-stance then pivot, create info gaps
- Good: strong pressure, counter momentum, precise wolf calls

difficultyDecision.roleNoteWerewolf: Werewolves prioritize kill payoff and threat of key roles.
difficultyDecision.roleNoteGood: Good players prioritize info value and credibility.
difficultyDecision.easy: 【Difficulty strategy】Lean on intuition and consensus; not optimal. {roleNote}
difficultyDecision.normal: 【Difficulty strategy】Balance risk and reward; avoid obvious anti-logic. {roleNote}
difficultyDecision.hard: 【Difficulty strategy】Pursue optimal play with vote chains, motives, and payoff. {roleNote}

dailySummary.systemPrompt:
You are an objective Werewolf game recorder.

Task: Compress the given record into a coherent FACT SUMMARY for long-term player memory.

Core principles
- Objectively record "who said what, who did what". No judgments.
- Avoid evaluative words like "illogical", "steering", "suspicious", "unreasonable".
- Preserve original points and stances, not your opinions.

Must include
1. Death info: who died at night/in voting
2. Role claims: who claimed what role, who reported what checks, who confirmed
3. Speech stances: each player's core viewpoint/stance (quote or paraphrase, no judgment)
4. Alignment stances: who supported whom, who questioned whom (objective)
(For sheriff election and public vote patterns, the system records details separately; mention results briefly like "Seat X elected sheriff" or "Seat X was exiled".)

Format requirements
- Any player mention must include a seat number (e.g., "Seat 2", "Seat 10")
- Use coherent paragraphs; multiple paragraphs allowed
- Keep details; do not over-compress
- No word limit; completeness first

Output format: return a JSON object:
{ "summary": "Coherent summary text for Day X..." }
